This game is NOT a worthy Sonic game.  Foremost, the physics in this game cause Sonic to lag and not move properly (ex: Not gaining momentum).  Even more, the gave has no character of its own.  Additionally, the music is not good.  Finally, the game does not function like a proper episodic game.  Therefore, I do not recommend Sonic 4 to anyone.

Frankly the game is garbage. I had to force myself to beat the first level and then uninstalled. The graphics are hard to look at and the reasons are many. The graphics wouldn‚Äôt be bad if the game weren‚Äôt so zoomed in. It feels like it should be zoomed out almost double, and thus your eyes squint the entire time trying to see where you‚Äôre going or how you‚Äôre gonna land when midair, etc. 

Also why is sonic 3D when the world is 2D? It throws everything off. 

Not worth the 3 bucks.

The 3D models look out of place with the HD sprites, and the animation looks horrible. It keeps crashing, and the level design is so bland. This game is not worth 3 dollars. I‚Äôm disappointed, Sega is capable make higher quality apps than this...

As a game its not truly bad but with its expectations things were supposed to be different due to hype. But I respect what they chose to do as a company to make this... I admit it feels... familiar. But I must also say they tried. I was impressed with its graphics despite the amount of MB it uses up to download, but it sadly just didn't feel natural. The game was a little clunky and didn't feel truly Sonic. But again, thats my only complaint. Its still a decent game.

title.label: Good, but better on other systems

content.label: This game is a decent Sonic title. Good levels and graphics along with smooth controls. But considering it‚Äôs mobile, you would have it better playing on Xbox or steam. Some levels replace others in this game, and those levels are more fun than the mobile levels. Good, but try the steam version.

So, I already don‚Äôt like Sonic 4 that much, but this port is probably the worst version to play. The jump and move buttons are tiny and can‚Äôt be altered in size like the Sonic 1 and Sonic 2 iOS ports, and the motion controls are bad as well. Even when you switch to touch controls, they‚Äôre still not very good for the special stages since they‚Äôre way too sensitive. Overall, if you do want to play Sonic 4 for whatever reason, you‚Äôre better off playing the console versions.

Tilting my screen is completely obnoxious. When I tilt left, my screen does an entire 180, causing me to ricochet off of things. It‚Äôs a horrible mechanic and could have been solved with the digital joystick. I like this game, but Super Sonic should not be attainable by using horrid mechanics.
